overview:
Ian Picache is a venture capitalist and entrepreneur. He has invested in a variety of businesses spanning a wide range of industries, previously with Technology Crossover Ventures, Vanguard Ventures and Telesoft Partners and currently with Picache Holdings.

As the co-founder of Roses & Rye, an apparel company based in San Francisco, Ian manages operations and finance. In 2010, he co-founded Bergine, a luxury flash-sale business. Seven months after launching, Internet retail pioneer Gilt Groupe acquired Bergine.

Ian began his career at Morgan Stanley. He is a graduate of Phillips Exeter Academy and received his B.A. from Dartmouth College and M.B.A. from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. Ian lives in San Francisco with his wife Patricia Calfee and family.

degrees.institution: The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania
